title: Tip Lewis and His Lamp
description: Tip Lewis is a mischievous, unpromising scamp. One Sunday, a visiting Sunday school teacher tells his mission class how her minister had grown up in similarly bad circumstances, but had decided to follow God and had never regretted it. Tip decides to try to BE somebody, like that minister did. He is given a Bible - his lamp - to use as a guide, and from there, his life begins to change. (Introduction by TriciaG)

sections.title: 01 - 'Cast thy bread upon the waters.'
02 - 'But other fell into good ground, and brought forth fruit.'
03 - 'Inasmuch as ye did it unto one of the least of these My brethren, ye did it unto Me.'
04 - 'They that seek Me shall find Me.'
05 - 'Thy word is a lamp to my feet.'
06 - 'I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt go. I will guide thee with Mine eye.'
07 - 'Fear not, for I have redeemed thee.'
08 - 'Freely ye have received, freely give.'
09 - 'Hitherto hath the Lord helped us.'
10 - 'Enter not into the path of the wicked.'
11 - 'Avoid it, pass not by it, turn from it, and pass away.'
12 - 'He honoureth them that fear the Lord.'
13 - 'The rich and poor meet together; the Lord is the Maker of them all.'
14 - 'Every idle word that men shall speak, they shall give account thereof in the day of judgment.'
15 - 'And all things, whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer, believing, ye shall receive.'
16 - 'Whosoever therefore shall confess Me before men, him will I confess also before My Father which is in heaven.'
17 - 'Behold how great a matter a little fire kindleth.'
18 - 'Thy father and thy mother shall be glad, and she that bore thee shall rejoice.'
19 - 'And all thy children shall be taught of the Lord.'
20 - 'Let him that thinketh he standeth, take heed lest he fall.'
21 - 'He shall call upon Me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble: I will deliver him, and honour him.'
22 - 'I will lead them in paths that they have not known.'
23 - 'A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.'
24 - 'Whatsoever ye would that men should do to you, do ye even so to them.'
25 - 'If ye abide in Me, and My word abide in you, ye shall ask what ye will, and it shall be done unto you.'
26 - 'And when they looked, they saw that the stone was rolled away.'
27 - 'Wherewithal shall a young man cleanse his way? By taking heed thereto, according to Thy word.'
28 - 'For thou shalt find it after many days.'
